bibl.title: The Historia Apollonii regis Tyri and the Odyssey.
bibl.note: Could P.S.I. II, 151 (= Pack2 2624) + P. Mil. Vogl. VI, 260 perhaps be fragments of the Greek original of the Historia? Does this papyrus prove that the Latin Historia is an abridged version?

bibl.title: Groningen Colloquia on the Novel. Volume III

bibl.seg: HOLZBERG Niklas, The Historia Apollonii regis Tyri and the Odyssey.
Heinz HOFMANN (Ed.), Groningen Colloquia on the Novel. Volume III (Groningen, 1990) pp. 91-101.
Could P.S.I. II, 151 (= Pack2 2624) + P. Mil. Vogl. VI, 260 perhaps be fragments of the Greek original of the Historia? Does this papyrus prove that the Latin Historia is an abridged version?
